Coding for Ares

These articles will teach you how to code for AresMUSH.

Beta Warning

Ares is still in beta, including the documentation. While it's stable overall, features are subject to change and some bugs are to be expected. Watch the Forum for updates.

Introduction

  • Ares Architecture - All the moving parts that make up an Ares game.
  • Coding for Ares - General overview of how coding for Ares works.

Basic Coding Tutorials

There are several tutorials designed to introduce you to Ares coding step by step. It’s recommended that you do these in order, since they all build on each other.

Tutorial #1 - Quickstart

Learn the basic Ares functions and code concepts.

  • Tutorial Overview
  • Try Ruby
  • Hello MUSH
  • Tinkering
  • Command Handlers
  • Emits
  • Templates
  • Command Switches and Args
  • Parsing Args
  • Command Error Checking
  • Configuration
  • Localization
  • Database Queries and Updates
  • Common APIs
  • Next Steps

Tutorial #2 - Editing Ares Code

Learn what tools you use to edit the Ares code.

  • Tutorial Overview
  • Finding Code
  • Direct Editing
  • FTP Upload
  • Next Steps

Tutorial #3 - Adding a Command (Character Goals)

Learn how to add a command (a simple ‘goals’ command to set character goals.)

  • Tutorial Overview
  • The Custom Plugin
  • Create a Help File
  • Create a Database Field
  • Create a Command Handler
  • Create Another Command Handler
  • Removing the Commands
  • Next Steps

Tutorial #4 - Creating a Plugin (Cortex Skills System)

Learn the anatomy of a more complex system (aka a plugin) from start to finish. The example uses the Cortex skills system.

  • Tutorial Overview
  • Create a Plugin Folder
  • Create a Plugin Module
  • Create a Config File
  • Create a Help File
  • Create a Database Model
  • Create the Abilities Command
  • Create the Set Ability Command
  • Create the Sheet Command
  • Expand the App Review Command
  • Create the Roll Command
  • Create a Translations File
  • Create a Dispatch Link
  • Next Steps

Tutorial #5 - Modifying the Web Portal (Web Goals)

Learn how to add things - in this case, the character goals from Tutorial #3 - to the web portal.

  • Tutorial Overview
  • Setting up the Data
  • Modifying the Web Request
  • Modifying the Character Template
  • Modifying the Edit Template
  • Modifying the Edit Request
  • Modifying Chargen
  • Next Steps

Advanced Coding Topics

Once you’ve completed the initial tutorials, there are a wealth of other topics available for reference.

Tip: It’s suggested that you refer to these as you need them rather than trying to learn them all at once. There’s a lot of information here and it can be a bit overwhelming.
